Issues.Title: build: fix circleci not restoring cache for PRs
Issues.Body:
Currently whenever someone creates a pull request, the NPM dependencies
are downloaded and installed. This is problematic because we have a lot
NPM dependencies with potentially large files that would need to be
downloaded (e.g. the Bazel binaries).

The caches are currently not being restored because we added the
`{Branch}` variable to the CircleCI cache key. Since every PR has a different
branch name (e.g. `devversion/refs/heads/my-banch`), the cache keys would
never match an existing cache key, and the PR would start fresh by
downloading everything.

We can safely remove the `{Branch}` variable from the cache key because
it does not provide any value since the cached files are based on the state
of the `yarn.lock` file and not based on the current branch name. This reduces
our dependency on the slow and sometimes **flaky** Yarn registry. We should
try to depend as few as possible on external services (e.g. see how Saucelabs
flakiness can cause trouble for the caretaker; same applies to flaky Yarn installs)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "build: fix circleci not restoring cache for PRs" (#28480)

Issues.Title: fix(bazel): Bazel builder should resolve with require.resolve()
Issues.Body:
This commit fixes a bug in the Bazel builder in which the path to Bazel
executable is constructed using the project path. For non-default
project, the node_modules directory is actually one level above the
project path.

This PR fixes the bug by resolving node_modules with require.resolve().
It requires @bazel/bazel v0.22.1 because previous versions do not have
index.js or main field in package.json and would cause node module
resolution to fail.

This has been tested with both bazel and ibazel.

Issues.Title: ci: fix symbol test to handle duplicate symbols
Issues.Body:
In 7cb8396, we improved the symbol test to remove suffixes from
the output, so "CIRCULAR$1" became "CIRCULAR". However, the logic
that checked for extra symbols depended on each symbol being unique.
If multiple symbols with the same name were added (e.g. pulled in
from separate files), they would be added to the map as "extras",
even if they were marked as expected in the golden file.

This commit updates the symbol checking logic to take multiple
symbols with the same name into account.

Closes #28406
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "ci: fix symbol test to handle duplicate symbols" (#28459)

Issues.Title: fix(ivy): mark views dirty by default when events fire
Issues.Body:
In Ivy, we support a new manual mode that allows for stricter control
over change detection in OnPush components. Specifically, in this mode,
events do not automatically mark OnPush views as dirty. Only changed
inputs and manual calls to `markDirty()` actually mark a view dirty.

However, this mode cannot be the default for OnPush components if we
want to be backwards compatible with View Engine. This commit re-adds
the legacy logic for OnPush components where events always mark views
dirty and makes it the default behavior.

Note: It is still TODO to add a public API for manual change detection.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(ivy): mark views dirty by default when events fire" (#28474)

Issues.Title: AOT: False positive compiler error when accessing enum in *ngFor
Issues.Body:
# 🐞 bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/compiler ### Is this a regression? No ### Description When accessing an Enum type with a `string` or `keyof` variable that has been set by *ngFor, the type is not detected correctly and AOT fails with resulting type errors if you enable `fullTemplateTypeCheck`. Example: ```
{{ OrderByMode[enumKey[index]] == OrderByMode.Distance }}
{{ OrderByMode[enumKey] == OrderByMode.Distance }}
``` The first comparison works, the second one fails with a compiler error, because `OrderByMode[enumKey]` is not detected as being of type `OrderByMode`. This prevents me from using template type checking in our project, as the compiler fails with wrongly detected errors. ## 🔬 Minimal Reproduction **Note:** Using Stackblitz for this is impossible as it doesn't provide AOT compilation. I set up a [minimal reproduction repo](https://github.com/magnattic/ng-template-enum). Steps to reproduce: 1. `git clone git@github.com:magnattic/ng-template-enum.git` 2. Run `npm run build:prod` ## 🔥 Exception or Error **This condition will always return 'false' since the types 'string' and 'OrderByMode' have no overlap.** ## 🌍 Your Environment **Angular Version:** 
Angular CLI: 7.2.2
Node: 10.15.0
OS: linux x64
Angular: 7.2.2
... animations, cdk, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core
... forms, http, language-service, material, platform-browser
... platform-browser-dynamic, platform-server, router

Package                            Version
------------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect          0.12.2
@angular-devkit/build-angular      0.12.2
@angular-devkit/build-ng-packagr   0.12.2
@angular-devkit/build-optimizer    0.12.2
@angular-devkit/build-webpack      0.12.2
@angular-devkit/core               7.2.2
@angular-devkit/schematics         7.2.2
@ngtools/json-schema               1.1.0
@ngtools/webpack                   7.2.2
@schematics/angular                7.2.2
@schematics/update                 0.12.2
ng-packagr                         4.6.0
rxjs                               6.3.3
typescript                         3.2.4
webpack                            4.28.4
**Anything else relevant?** `fullTemplateTypeCheck` has to be enabled. This last time I opened this issue (https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/28369) it got closed because of no reproduction. I hope this one is clearer. This issue could be related to (and possibly fixed by?) https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/12398
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "AOT: False positive compiler error when accessing enum in *ngFor" (#28469)

Issues.Title: Service Worker: missing ressource cause SW to fail silently
Issues.Body:
# 🚀 feature request

### Relevant Package
angular/service-worker

### Description
When a ressource that should be prefetched from the manifest is missing the SW enter a failsafe state `EXISTING_CLIENTS_ONLY`.
The issue with this is that it happens silently: it's really difficult to pinpoint the root cause of the problem. In my case a missing favicon in the target environment made the whole system fail. It took me three hours of debugging and backtracking to find what was wrong.

### Describe the solution you'd like
Please add some sensible error logging. A simple console.error when this throws (https://github.com/angular/service-worker-builds/blob/master/ngsw-worker.js#L780) could have turned thoses hours of painfull debugging in just seconds.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Service Worker: missing ressource cause SW to fail silently" (#28464)

Issues.Title: fix(bazel): fix integration test for bazel-schematics
Issues.Body:
With the release of @angular/bazel v7.2.3, the npm install step right
after `ng new` installs this version. However there is a bug in the
builder which results in bazel executable not found.

This bug was not discovered before because the dependencies of the
project created by `ng new` are not pinned.

The fix is to pin the version of @angular/bazel to 7.2.2 which relies on
global installation of bazel. This serves to unblock the broken CI. A proper
fix will be submitted in a follow-up PR.

Issues.Title: ci: keep job alive when yarn request takes more than 10 minutes
Issues.Body:
Occasionally, yarn's requests take more than 10 minutes to complete/fail, by which time CircleCI jobs due to no output.
This PR works around the issue by periodically printing something to stdout.

This avoids flakes, but builds can take up much more time (e.g. 30mins), which is slower than waiting for the build to fail and restart (10mins + 10mins) 🤷‍♂️
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "ci: keep job alive when yarn request takes more than 10 minutes" (#28458)

Issues.Body:
Currently, DOM node removal called `removeChild` on the saved parent
node when destroying a component. However, this will fail if the
component has been manually moved in the DOM. This change makes the
removal always use the node's real `parentNode` and ignore the provided
`parent`.

Reference: FW-977
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(ivy): remove DOM nodes from their real parent vs saved parent" (#28455)

Issues.Title: Compiler do not see module / ng-packagr lib
Issues.Body:
# 🐞 Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) ``` - [ ] new - [x] build - [x] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ``` ### Is this a regression? Previous behavior is unknown to me. ### Description I have made library with Angular CLI. Everything compiles like it should, all files are visible inside `dist` folder and they even work correctly when imported via lib. name. ```ts import { ExampleModule, SecondaryModule } from "example-lib-name"; ``` But when i trying to import it directly from a folder (just to keep my imports more precised) ```ts import { ExampleModule} from "example-lib-name"; import { SecondaryModule } from "example-lib-name/subfolder"; ``` i getting error about missing module despite file being where it should. ( detailed message bellow ) Visual Studio doesn't complain about missing files, in fact you can without any problem navigate into it by clicking on import path. I got the same error when importing that created package via npm. Attempts to include files via `tsconfig` options `include` and `files` also didn't change anything. ## 🔬 Minimal Reproduction Generate new project by executing: ```bash ng new example-lib-app && cd example-lib-app && ng generate library example-lib-name --prefix=eln && cd ./projects/example-lib-name/src/lib && ng g module secondaryModule && cd .. && echo "export * from './lib/secondary-module/secondary-module.module';" >> ./public_api.ts && cd ../../../ && cd ./src/app && npm install typescript@2.8.4 && ng build example-lib-name --prod && sed "5 i\import { SecondaryModuleModule } from 'example-lib-name/lib/secondary-module/secondary-module.module';" app.module.ts | tee app.module.ts && sed "13 i\ , SecondaryModuleModule" app.module.ts | tee app.module.ts && ng serve ``` Or clone and `ng serve` project from: 
https://github.com/ZBAGI/example-lib-name-bug.git
## 🔥 Error 

ERROR in ./src/app/app.module.ts
Module not found: Error: Can't resolve 'D:\Projects\test\example-lib-app\dist\example-lib-name\lib\secondary-module\secondary-module.module' in 'D:\Projects\test\example-lib-app\src\app'
## 🌍 Your Environment Visual Studio Code 1.28.1 ``` Angular CLI: 6.1.5 Node: 8.9.2 OS: win32 x64 Angular: ... Package Version ------------------------------------------------------ @angular-devkit/architect 0.7.5 @angular-devkit/core 0.7.5 @angular-devkit/schematics 0.7.5 @schematics/angular 0.7.5 @schematics/update 0.7.5 rxjs 6.3.2 typescript 2.9.2 ``` ```json "dependencies": { "@angular/animations": "^6.1.0", "@angular/common": "^6.1.0", "@angular/compiler": "^6.1.0", "@angular/core": "^6.1.0", "@angular/forms": "^6.1.0", "@angular/http": "^6.1.0", "@angular/platform-browser": "^6.1.0", "@angular/platform-browser-dynamic": "^6.1.0", "@angular/router": "^6.1.0", "core-js": "^2.5.4", "rxjs": "^6.0.0", "zone.js": "~0.8.26" }, "devDependencies": { "@angular-devkit/build-angular": "~0.7.0", "@angular-devkit/build-ng-packagr": "~0.7.0", "@angular/cli": "~6.1.5", "@angular/compiler-cli": "^6.1.0", "@angular/language-service": "^6.1.0", "@types/jasmine": "~2.8.6", "@types/jasminewd2": "~2.0.3", "@types/node": "~8.9.4", "codelyzer": "~4.2.1", "jasmine-core": "~2.99.1", "jasmine-spec-reporter": "~4.2.1", "karma": "~1.7.1", "karma-chrome-launcher": "~2.2.0", "karma-coverage-istanbul-reporter": "~2.0.0", "karma-jasmine": "~1.1.1", "karma-jasmine-html-reporter": "^0.2.2", "ng-packagr": "^3.0.0", "protractor": "~5.4.0", "ts-node": "~5.0.1", "tsickle": ">=0.29.0", "tslib": "^1.9.0", "tslint": "~5.9.1", "typescript": "^2.8.4" } ```

Issues.Title: @ngtools/webpack adds ./ to resource when using additional loader
Issues.Body:
# 🐞 Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) ``` - [ ] new - [x] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ``` ### Is this a regression? No ### Description A clear and concise description of the problem... When you add extra loader to component template like this: ```typescript @Component({ templateUrl: 'my-loader!./my.component.html', }) export class MyComponent {} ``` Webpack build fails because transformer adds ./ in the beginning and webpack cannot resolve "./my-loader!./my.component.html" ## 🔬 Minimal Reproduction https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-hgudjb?file=src%2Fapp%2Fapp.component.ts ## 🔥 Exception or Error 
Module not found: Error: Can't resolve './raw-loader' in 'my.component.ts'
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "@ngtools/webpack adds ./ to resource when using additional loader" (#13559)

Issues.Title: Budgets - minimum threshold incorrect behavior - cli v7
Issues.Body:
# 🐞 Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) ``` - [ ] new - [x] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ``` ### Is this a regression? One of the versions, in which the bug is not reproduced is 1.7.4 ### Description **(thresholds are declared as absolute values in this case)** I suppose it is considered, that minimum budget threshold is the MINIMUM expected size, which means, dropping below this level is percieved as an error/warning. Otherwise, if the size settles in [minimum - baseline] bounds, it is considered as OK build. But. Using angular-cli v7.1.1 makes this simple logic visa versa. Dropping below minimum threshold is OK, getting in between minimum and baseline causes error/warning. Declaring minimum thresholds as negative values in `minimumWarning`/`minimumError` fixes the problem, but in this case it doesnt make sence to use `warning` or `error`, because the bug appears. ## 🔬 Minimal Reproduction Try to build an app with the initial size of XXX, and YYY, ZZZ minimum thresholds. 

"budgets": [
      {
           "type": "initial",
           "baseline": "XXX",
           "minimumWarning": "YYY",
           "minimumError": "ZZZ"
      }
]
OR declare overall threshold 

"budgets": [
      {
           "type": "initial",
           "baseline": "XXX",
           "warning": "YYY",
           "error": "ZZZ"
      }
]
`npm run build` for the configuration with budgets ## 🔥 Exception or Error 

WARNING in budgets, minimum exceeded for main. Budget (XXX+YYY) was not reached by YYY.

ERROR in budgets, minimum exceeded for main. Budget (XXX+ZZZ) was not reached by ZZZ.
## 🌍 Your Environment 

Angular CLI: 7.1.1
Node: 8.12.0
OS: win32 x64
Angular: 7.1.1
... animations, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... http, language-service, platform-browser
... platform-browser-dynamic, platform-server, router

Issues.Title: Regression in 7.3.0 when choosing SASS as preprocessor
Issues.Body:
# 🐞 Bug report

### Command (mark with an `x`)
<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are effected by this bug? -->
<!-- ✍️edit: -->
```
- [x] new
- [x] build
- [x] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc
```

### Is this a regression?

<!-- Did this behavior use to work in the previous version? -->
Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: All 7.x before 7.3.0

### Description

When choosing Sass as the stylesheet preprocessor, CLI produces `styles.scss` but `angular.json` expects `styles.sass`.
Previous available choice of "Scss" is gone.

## 🔬 Minimal Reproduction

1. `ng new`
1. Choose `Sass` as the stylesheet format
1. `ng build` or `ng serve`

## 🔥 Exception or Error
```
ERROR in multi ./src/styles.sass
Module not found: Error: Can't resolve '[...]/src/styles.sass' in '[...]'
```
`[...]` above refers to the project folder.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Regression in 7.3.0 when choosing SASS as preprocessor" (#13550)

Issues.Title: fix(@angular/cli): ng-add should resolve package.json
Issues.Body:
`ng-add` checks if a specified collection is installed, and if not it'd
proceed to install the package. However, `isPackageInstalled()` would, by
default, resolve the main field or the index of the package. Not all NPM
packages specify the main field or provide an index file. It should
be sufficient to just check the presence of `package.json` to detect
whether a package is installed or not.

For example, `ng add @angular/bazel` should not install the package if
it's already installed locally. `@angular/bazel` does not specify a main
field nor an index file in its `package.json`.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(@angular/cli): ng-add should resolve package.json" (#13536)

Issues.Title: Schematics options camelCase coercion
Issues.Body:
# 🚀 Feature request


### Command (mark with an `x`)
<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ✍️edit: -->
```
- [ ] new
- [ ] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc
- [x] schematics
```

### Description
When passing arguments to `schematics` as options, I would like to be able to pass a dash-case option (i.e. `---dry-run`) and get the camelCase equivalent (i.e. `dryRun`) in the options passed to my schematic.

Currently, if I pass the option `option-one` as a dash-case argument...
```bash
schematics my-collection:my-schematic --option-one=test
```
The factory function will receive the following options object...
```json
{
    "option-one": "test"
}
```

Furthermore, if I were to pass both the dash-case and camelCase equivalent of the same argument like so...
```bash
schematics my-collection:my-schematic --option-one=test1 --optionOne=test2
```
The factory function will receive the following options object...
```json
{
    "option-one": "test1",
    "optionOne": "test2"
}
```

This is not only very confusing but also inconsistent with the base schematics options such as `--dry-run`. Meaning that the following two commands are analogous...

```bash
schematics my-collection:my-schematic --dry-run=true
schematics my-collection:my-schematic --dryRun=true
```
Thereby treating `dry-run` as `dryRun`. I don't see a great use case for allowing two arguments of different cases to coexist.

### Describe the solution you'd like
#### Option 1
Coerce all options argument to camelCase.

#### Option 2
Smart case corecursion of all options argument based on options schema.

### Describe alternatives you've considered
Checking for both dash-case and camelCase options and resolving each option manually based on expected options schema.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Schematics options camelCase coercion" (#13544)

Issues.Title: Enable building with source maps generated as inline-source-map
Issues.Body:
# 🚀 Feature request
Enable configure angular-cli to create inline source maps.
The problem is that it is not possible to debug hybrid/cordova based apps built with angular on android devices. The reason is that Chrome debugger cannot access the source map file on the device. The solution/fix is to include the source map inline

For example, here is one of the issue related to this https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/issues/6674
The temporary hack described [here](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/52499545/how-to-configure-angular-cli-to-create-inline-sourcemaps/53850796#53850796) however it would be very helpful to be able to configure angular cli using standard methods to generate inline source maps.

### Command (mark with an `x`)
<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ✍️edit: -->
```
- [ ] new
- [x] build
- [x] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc
```

### Description
<!-- ✍️--> A clear and concise description of the problem or missing capability...
As I understand (based on @angular-devkit/build-angular) angular cli either uses eval or source-map as a webpack devtool option (https://webpack.js.org/configuration/devtool/). There is no standard way to use a different devtool option for source maps generated.

### Describe the solution you'd like
<!-- ✍️--> If you have a solution in mind, please describe it.
Add devtool or similar build option (smth like deprecated evalSourceMap build option but allowing to set any supported webpack devtool option)

### Describe alternatives you've considered
<!-- ✍️--> Have you considered any alternative solutions or workarounds?
Options 1) The temporary hack described [here](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/52499545/how-to-configure-angular-cli-to-create-inline-sourcemaps/53850796#53850796)
Option 2) Use custom tools to extend the Angular CLI build behaviour, for example https://github.com/manfredsteyer/ngx-build-plus
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue " Enable building with source maps generated as inline-source-map" (#13543)

Issues.Title: ng test does not react properly when detecting a code change
Issues.Body:
As requested by @filipesilva, I tested this issue again on a newer CLI version: https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/issues/9901

The result is that the bug is exactly the same as before. As described in the original issue.

I post here my new `ng --version` as well as the (same) description of the bug.

### Versions
```
Angular CLI: 7.2.3
Node: 10.15.0
OS: linux x64
Angular: 7.2.2
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... http, language-service, platform-browser
... platform-browser-dynamic, router

Package                           Version
-----------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect         0.12.3
@angular-devkit/build-angular     0.12.3
@angular-devkit/build-optimizer   0.12.3
@angular-devkit/build-webpack     0.12.3
@angular-devkit/core              7.2.3
@angular-devkit/schematics        7.2.3
@angular/cli                      7.2.3
@ngtools/webpack                  7.2.3
@schematics/angular               7.2.3
@schematics/update                0.12.3
rxjs                              6.3.3
typescript                        3.2.4
webpack                           4.28.4

```

### Repro steps
* Setup an Angular app with many unit test cases
* Run your unit tests
* While they are running, change a file and force to run a single case set to run (by using `fdescribe` or `fit`) 


### Observed behavior

It will recompile (or at least it looks like it) but it will still keep continuing the previous run instead of starting a new one with the specific test cases set.

So every time I need to use `fdescribe` or `fit` I need either to wait that the current test run finishes or I have to manually kill and restart `ng test

### Desired behavior

Whenever something changes in the code, `ng test` should just recompile and rerun again from the beginning and taking into account any changes related to the test cases set to run (e.g. any usage of `fdescribe` or `fit` should be taken into account without the need of restarting the cli process)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "ng test does not react properly when detecting a code change" (#13542)

Issues.Title: Can't resolve '@ngtools/webpack' in yarn monorepo
Issues.Body:
# 🐞 Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) ``` - [ ] new - [x] build - [x] serve - [x] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ``` ### Is this a regression? No. (Perhaps in a really old version before migrating to the monorepo structure, see more in description) ### Description During the build process (on `build`, `serve` or `test`) an error occurs (see below) and the build fails. The `@ngtools/webpack` package can not be resolved. This happens due to a yarn monorepo structure, in which `@ngtools/webpack` will not be placed in the root `./node_modules` folder due conflicts with other dependencies, so it gets placed under `./node_modules/@angular-devkit/build-angular/node_modules`. And then it can not be found during build. I tracked down the issue and found the source. You can see the problem also in issue #10220. It was fixed by @hansl in the old single repo: https://github.com/angular/devkit/pull/647 but didn't get copied to the new monorepo? --> https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/master/packages/angular_devkit/build_angular/src/angular-cli-files/models/webpack-configs/typescript.ts#L23 **Can we do this change once again?** If I change those lines locally the build is successful, but I do not know if we can simply change this without other problems? Note: If you have a monorepo with only one angular application this problem should not happen, but in my case the monorepo has also some angularjs applications and multiple webpack configurations. So multiple webpack, loader and angular dependency versions are around, not all aligned. ## 🔬 Minimal Reproduction Reproduction repo: https://github.com/fabianbru/angular-cli-bug-reproduction This repo is a striped down repo, so there are many dependencies without real code. Step-by-Step guide: - Node 10 (Node version should not matter) - yarn 1.13.0 - Checkout - run `yarn` in the root to install all dependencies - run `yarn dev` in the root --> ERROR will occur - change lines 7-9 locally in `node_modules/@angular-devkit/build-angular/src/angular-cli-files/models/webpack-configs/typescript.js` to: ``` const webpackLoader = require.resolve('@ngtools/webpack') ``` ---> build should be successful ## 🔥 Exception or Error 


ERROR in multi /angular-cli-bug-reproduction/node_modules/webpack-dev-server/client?http://0.0.0.0:0 webpack/hot/dev-server ./src/main.ts
Module not found: Error: Can't resolve '@ngtools/webpack' in '/angular-cli-bug-reproduction/packages/angular'
ERROR in multi ./src/polyfills.ts
Module not found: Error: Can't resolve '@ngtools/webpack' in '/angular-cli-bug-reproduction/packages/angular'

 is the path to my workspace, like `/Users/xyz/workspace`
## 🌍 Your Environment 


Angular CLI: 7.2.3
Node: 10.15.0
OS: darwin x64
Angular: 7.2.2
... animations, cdk, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... http, language-service, material, platform-browser
... platform-browser-dynamic, platform-server, router

-----------------------------------------------------------

@angular-devkit/build-angular     0.12.3
@angular-devkit/build-optimizer   0.12.3
@angular-devkit/core              7.2.3
@angular-devkit/schematics        7.2.3
@angular/cli                      7.2.3
@angular/flex-layout              7.0.0-beta.23
@schematics/angular               7.2.3
@schematics/update                0.12.3

Issues.Title: make aria-describedby optional for matTooltip
Issues.Body:
#### Bug, feature request, or proposal: when matTooltip is used, aria-describedby is auto added. I want to make this optional. #### What is the expected behavior? Make this optional. #### What is the current behavior? It is automatically, there is no way to turn this off. #### What are the steps to reproduce? Providing a StackBlitz reproduction is the *best* way to share your issue.
StackBlitz starter: https://goo.gl/wwnhMV
#### What is the use-case or motivation for changing an existing behavior? when JAWS is used, JAWS ignores aria-describeby during linear navigation. aria-label can be recognized by all screen reader. However, If I have both matTooltip, and aria-label, the text will be announced twice by VoiceOver and Vox. So I intend to use the matTooltip like this [matTooltip]="my text" aria-label="my text" no-describedby. By this way, I completely control the accessibility behavior. #### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected? #### Is there anything else we should know?

Issues.Title: "Mouse over" tooltip example is not keyboard accessible
Issues.Body:

It must be possible to activate tooltips in the "tooltip that can be manually shown/hidden" example by only using a keyboard.

#### What is the current behavior?
It is not possible to activate tooltips in the "tooltip that can be manually shown/hidden" example by only using a keyboard.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
1. Open the [tooltip example page](https://material.angular.io/components/tooltip/examples)
2. Press tab until you reach the "show", "hide", "toggle show/hide" buttons in the "tooltip that can be manually shown/hidden" example.
3. Press enter to activate the buttons.
4. Observe that the tooltip is now shown or hidden.

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
- Angular Material Example 7.2.2 located at https://material.angular.io/components/
- Windows 10
- Firefox 64

#### Is there anything else we should know?
This is an issue with the way that the example is implemented, but the example should demonstrate accessible behavior.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue ""Mouse over" tooltip example is not keyboard accessible" (#15044)

Issues.Title: Snackbar examples disappear with no ability to adjust timing
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
Users should have enough time to find and interact with the example snackbar content before it disappears.

#### What is the current behavior?
Users might not have enough time to find and interact with the example snackbar content before it disappears.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
1. Open the [snackbar example](https://material.angular.io/components/snack-bar/examples)
2. Click the "pizza party" button
3. Observe that the snackbar is displayed for about 3 seconds before being removed

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
- Angular Material Example 7.2.2 located at https://material.angular.io/components/
- NVDA 2018.4.1 + FireFox 64
- VoiceOver for IOS (12.1.3) + Safari (12.1.3)

#### Is there anything else we should know?
With the current timeout, users might not be able to find the content when using a screen magnifier before it disappears.

A few possible solutions might be to:
1. add a mechanism to the example that lets users adjust the timeout
2. require that users acknowledge the snackbar before it disappears

This issue should also be discussed in the accessibility section of the documentation for the component.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Snackbar examples disappear with no ability to adjust timing " (#15043)

Issues.Title: Menu button in example is missing an accessible name
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
The purpose of the menu button in the "menu with icons" example must be conveyed to users of screen reader software.

#### What is the current behavior?
The purpose of the menu button in the "menu with icons" example is not conveyed to users of screen reader software.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
1. Using either of the following screen readers
   - NVDA 2018.4.1 + Firefox 64
   - VoiceOver for IOS (12.1.3) + Safari
2. Open the [menu example](https://material.angular.io/components/menu/examples)
3. Navigate to the menu button in the "menu with icons" example
   - In NVDA you can press the tab key until you reach the menu button
   - In VoiceOver for iOS you can swipe right until you reach the menu button
4. Observe that the menu button is announced as something like "menu button subMenu". In this case, "menu button" is the role of the element, not the name, and as such, the name of the menu button is not announced by the screen reader. Contrast this menu button to the menu button "basic menu" example, which is announced as "Menu, menu button subMenu". The name should be used to distinguish the menu buttom from other menu buttons on the page.

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
- Angular Material Example 7.2.2 located at https://material.angular.io/components/
- NVDA 2018.4.1 + FireFox 64
- VoiceOver for IOS (12.1.3) + Safari (12.1.3)

#### Is there anything else we should know?
The [documentation for the menu component](https://material.angular.io/components/menu/overview) states

> Menu triggers or menu items without text or labels should be given a meaningful label via `aria-label` or `aria-labelledby`

The example should be updated to follow that advice.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Menu button in example is missing an accessible name" (#15039)

Issues.Title: Slider is not operable when using VoiceOver on iOS
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
It must be possible to adjust the value of the slider component while using VoiceOver on iOS.

#### What is the current behavior?
It is not possible to adjust the value of the slider component while using VoiceOver on iOS. 

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
1. Using VoiceOver for IOS (12.1.3) + Safari
2. Open the [slider example](https://material.angular.io/components/slider/examples)
3. Navigate to one slider the example
   - In VoiceOver for iOS you can swipe right until you reach the slider
4. Observe that Voice Over announces "0%, adjustable. Swipe up or down with one finger to adjust the value"
5. Swipe up or down to adjust the value
6. Observe that the value was not changed

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
- Angular Material Example 7.2.2 located at https://material.angular.io/components/
- VoiceOver for IOS (12.1.3) + Safari (12.1.3)

#### Is there anything else we should know?
To my knowedge, it is not currently possible for JS to listen to the events fired by VoiceOver to adjust the value. This also likely applies to other touch-based screen readers, including Talkback for android. There is a [relevent discussion about this in the aria-practices repo](https://github.com/w3c/aria-practices/issues/8). This issue will likely be addressed by the future AOM standard, which creates several [new inputEvent types](https://github.com/WICG/aom/blob/gh-pages/explainer.md#new-inputevent-types).

Until then, it might be possible to use an [html `range` input](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/input/range) in most situations.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Slider is not operable when using VoiceOver on iOS" (#15037)

Issues.Title: Keep a visual indication of where the cdkDrag element is when starting to drag
Issues.Body:
#### Please describe the feature you would like to request.
Whenever the user starts to drag an element it must be possible to have a visual indication of where in the list the element is being dragged from until it is dropped.

#### What is the use-case or motivation for this proposal?
While dragging an element it is in many scenarios very important that you know where the element was originally placed because that information is currently lost when starting to drag.

This is important in all scenarios where the order of draggable elements is critical. If the order of the elements are critical and you start to drag an element and then lose the original position, then the user is forced to remember the position of the element or drop the element somewhere.

#### Is there anything else we should know?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Keep a visual indication of where the cdkDrag element is when starting to drag" (#15034)

Issues.Title: [mat-autocomplete] openPanel() get called unexpectedly in _handleInput
Issues.Body:
#### What are the steps to reproduce?
https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-material-autocomplete-async-test

1. Type something short, e.g., “w”
2. Some suggestions come up
3. Select the first one "Windstorm" and hit ENTER
4. The field is filled by "Windstorm", at the same time, autocomplete panel closed.
5. Continue typing an extra char, making it “Windstormd” (which shouldn't match any suggestion and hence empty panel)

#### What is the expected behavior?

No autocomplete panel shows up after I typed the extra "d".

#### What is the current behavior?

Autocomplete panel quickly shows up (showing previous matched value "Windstorm") and then closed.

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?

@angular/material 7.3.0, @angular/core 7.2.3. 
macOS 10.14.1

#### Is there anything else we should know?

After a deep dive, I know the root cause of this, but couldn't find a way to workaround:

Basically, what happened under the hood is as follows:
1. Type something short, e.g., “w”
2. Some suggestions come up
3. Select the first one "Windstorm" and hit ENTER
4. The field is filled by "Windstorm", at the same time, autocomplete panel closed. What happened here are:
    1. `_handleKeydown` got called (http://bit.ly/2DKe23T)
    2. `_setValueAndClose` got called (? not 100% sure)
    3. `valueChange` of the form detected
    4. In my app, `filteredValues` updated to one single suggestion (only "Windstorm" matches)
5. Continue typing a extra char, making it “Windstormd” (which shouldn't match any suggestion and hence empty panel). What happened here are:
    1. `_handleInput` got called (http://bit.ly/2DM8JBf)
    2. in `_handleInput`, `this.openPanel()` get called. That's why the panel "quickly" opened, showing "previous" panel value "Windstorm"
    3. `valueChange` of the form detected
    4. In my app, `filteredValues` updated
    5. Panel closed due to empty suggestion list

I am not sure if this is the expected behavior, but this unexpected call for `openPanel()` in `_handleInput` is a bit confusing and looks weird. Are there any workaround for this?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[mat-autocomplete] openPanel() get called unexpectedly in _handleInput" (#15028)

Issues.Title: The label on a mat form field with Outline with a prefix not aligning inside a dialog
Issues.Body:
Bug:

Form-Field-Outline-Label-Gap does not reposition correctly when it is opened in a dialog and the Form-Field has a prefix.

This bug still exists in the latest version

there is an existing issue which is closed:
https://github.com/angular/material2/issues/13769


![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/27024161/52020283-c17b9a00-24be-11e9-8a6b-a4ce3c4229be.png)

What is the expected behavior?
The Form-Field-Outline-Label-Gap should be positioned correctly with or without a prefix. Inside a dialog.

What is the current behavior?
The Form-Field-Outline-Label-Gap does not reposition itself away from the form field prefix like the label does when it is opened in a dialog.

What are the steps to reproduce?

I edited the stackblitz
https://stackblitz.com/edit/form-field-outline-label-gap-position-error-in-dialog

Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
Angular 7.2.3
Angular Material 7.0.3
chrome: 71
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "The label on a mat form field with Outline with a prefix not aligning inside a dialog" (#15027)

Issues.Title: Radio button example is missing a group label
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
The purpose of the group of radio buttons in the radio button example must be conveyed to users of screen reader software when a radio button in the group recieves focus.

#### What is the current behavior?
The purpose of the group of radio buttons in the radio button example is not conveyed to users of screen reader software when a radio button in the group recieves focus.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
1. Using either of the following screen readers
   - NVDA 2018.4.1 + Firefox 64
   - VoiceOver for IOS (12.1.3) + Safari
2. Open the [table example](https://material.angular.io/components/radio/examples)
3. Navigate to one of the checkboxes in the buttons in the 'table with selection' example.
   - In NVDA you can press the tab key until you reach a radio button
   - In VoiceOver for iOS you can swipe right until you reach a radio button
4. Observe that the purpose of the group of radio buttons is not announced by the screen reader. It should be announced as something like "what is your favorite season?"

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
- Angular Material Example 7.2.2 located at https://material.angular.io/components/
- NVDA 2018.4.1 + FireFox 64
- VoiceOver for IOS (12.1.3) + Safari (12.1.3)

#### Is there anything else we should know?
It is also important to point out that the group label must be visible too. In the case of this example, the text 'Your favorite season is' could be considered the group label.

https://github.com/angular/material2/issues/7556 is a related issue but isn't focused on accessibility.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Radio button example is missing a group label" (#15026)

Issues.Title: password visibility toggle example in form field component is not accessible
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
1. It must be possible to operate the password visibility toggle button in the form field example by only using a keyboard
2. Roles, states, and properties must be present so that users of screen reader software are aware that the of the toggle functionality

#### What is the current behavior?
1. It is not possible to operate the password visibility toggle button in the form field example by only using a keyboard
2. Roles, states, and properties are not present so that users of screen reader software are aware that the of the toggle functionality

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
1. Using either of the following screen readers
   - NVDA 2018.4.1 + Firefox 64
   - VoiceOver for IOS (12.1.3) + Safari
2. Open the [form field example](https://material.angular.io/components/form-field/examples)
3. Navigate to the passord visibility toggle button in the "Form field with prefix & suffix" example
   - In NVDA you can press the tab key until you reach it
   - In VoiceOver for iOS you can swipe right until you reach it
4. With NVDA observe that the tab key does not focus the button
5. With VoiceOver for iOS observe that the button is skipped
6. Observe that it is not possible to activate the button by pressing space or enter keys
7. Observe that the name, role, and state of the toggle button is not announced by the screen reader.

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
- Angular Material Example 7.2.2 located at https://material.angular.io/components/
- NVDA 2018.4.1 + FireFox 64
- VoiceOver for IOS (12.1.3) + Safari (12.1.3)

#### Is there anything else we should know?
Note that this example is also included in the [form field overview page](https://material.angular.io/components/form-field/overview).
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "password visibility toggle example in form field component is not accessible" (#15023)

Issues.Title: Native select examples are missing programatic labels
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
The purpose of the native select elements in the select example must be conveyed to users of screen reader software.

#### What is the current behavior?
The purpose of the native select elements in the select example is not conveyed to users of screen reader software.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
1. Using either of the following screen readers
   - NVDA 2018.4.1 + Firefox 64
   - VoiceOver for IOS (12.1.3) + Safari
2. Open the [select example](https://material.angular.io/components/select/examples)
3. Navigate to one of the native select elements in the examples.
   - In NVDA you can press the tab key until you reach a select element
   - In VoiceOver for iOS you can swipe right until you reach a select element
4. Observe that the purpose of the select element is not conveyed by the screen reader.

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
- Angular Material Example 7.2.2 located at https://material.angular.io/components/
- NVDA 2018.4.1 + FireFox 64
- VoiceOver for IOS (12.1.3) + Safari (12.1.3)

#### Is there anything else we should know?
Select elements must have a meaningful programmatic label. This does not appear to be an issue with the component itself, but rather with the way that the examples are implemented. The examples should be updated to demonstrate accessible implementations.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Native select examples are missing programatic labels" (#15022)
